user_sentiment: Likely satisfied or neutral - the empty follow-up message after session end suggests either completion acceptance or disengagement.
execution_quality: The agent entered plan mode appropriately, created a structured implementation plan, consulted with the user on approach preferences, and generated initial onboarding files with reasonable scaffold code.
work_category: Feature planning and implementation for an onboarding system that guides users through Claude Code configuration options on first launch, including mode and settings selection with explanatory walkthrough.
summary: The agent appropriately used plan mode to design an interactive onboarding system, created scaffold code for implementation, and asked clarifying questions about the feature approach. However, the work remained at the planning/scaffold stage rather than delivering a complete, tested implementation. The empty user response after session end leaves actual alignment uncertain—the user may have wanted more complete code or may have found the planning sufficient for their needs.
follow_up_pattern: Session ended without further user input, suggesting either the user accepted the work and will implement/iterate asynchronously, or deferred the task for later consideration.
